FuncDef: The reset ls-port-queue statistics command clears statistics about all class queues or a specific class queue on a specified interface on the low-speed interface card.
CLIs: reset ls-port-queue statistics { all | interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } [ be | af1 | af2 | af3 | af4 | ef | cs6 | cs7 ] } outbound

ParaDef.Info:
Clears statistics about port queues on all low-speed interfaces.
-

Specifies the name of an interface.
-

Specifies the name of an interface.
The value can be MP-Group interface, Global-MP-Group interface view, Serial interface, Trunk-Serial interface view.

Specifies the name of an interface.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as be.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as af1.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as af2.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as af3.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as af4.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as ef.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as cs6.
-

Specifies the service level of a queue as cs7.
-

resets statistics about port queues on an outbound interface.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset ls-port-queue statistics interface serial 1/0/0/1:0 outbound
<HUAWEI> reset ls-port-queue statistics interface serial 1/0/0/1:0 af1 outbound
ExtraInfo: The reset ls-port-queue statistics command clears statistics about all class queues or a specific class queue on a specified interface on the low-speed interface card.
